purpose: Records that an entity has formed a relationship by updating its cooldown tracking data in the graph
Computes a numeric significance score for a narrative event based on its kind, the subject entity's prominence, and the magnitude of state changes
Normalizes a prominence value that may be either a numeric score or a legacy string label into a comparable numeric value
Produces a set of semantic tags classifying a narrative event by its kind, the subject's type, and the relationship between subject and object
Returns a default narrative configuration object with narrative recording enabled and minimum significance set to zero
Type guard that narrows a tracked mutation to the entity_created variant, confirming the mutation carries entity creation data
Type guard that narrows a tracked mutation to the relationship_created variant, confirming the mutation carries relationship creation data
Type guard that narrows a tracked mutation to the relationship_archived variant, confirming the mutation carries relationship archival data
Type guard that narrows a tracked mutation to a tag change variant, matching both tag_added and tag_removed mutation types

Derives a unique string key for grouping mutations that share the same execution context (source, sourceId, and tick)
Replaces curly-brace token placeholders in a narration template string with resolved entity names and values from a context object

Builds a NarrationContext suited for system rule execution, binding self, member, and member2 entities
Builds a NarrationContext for template or generator execution, binding target and selected entities along with free-form variables
Produces a set of semantic tags classifying a narrative event by its kind, the subject's entity type, and the subject-object relationship
Computes the overall narrative significance score for an event by dispatching to the appropriate sub-calculator based on event kind
Normalizes a prominence value from either a numeric score or a legacy string label into a unified numeric value for comparison
Scores a tag-change narrative event using the tag's category, rarity metadata, and the affected entity's prominence level
Scores a batch entity-creation narrative event based on the number of entities created, relationships formed, and primary entity prominence
Scores a relationship-formation narrative event using the relationship's polarity and the combined prominence of the connected entities
Returns a default narrative configuration object with narrative recording enabled and minimum significance threshold set to zero
Determines whether an entity satisfies all actor requirements (kind, subtype, tag filters) specified in an action's actor configuration
Constructs a RuleContext that binds a graph view and an entity resolver together, optionally scoping it to a specific self entity
Constructs a RuleContext for system-level execution where no variable resolution is needed, wrapping only a graph view
Constructs a RuleContext for action execution, binding the acting entity as the actor and optionally a current entity as self
Derives a new RuleContext from an existing one with a different entity set as self, leaving all other bindings unchanged
Traverses the entity graph from a starting entity along a declared relationship path and tests whether the terminal assertion holds
Constructs a RuleContext that binds a graph view and entity resolver together, optionally scoping it to a specific self entity
Constructs a RuleContext for system-level execution where no variable resolution is needed, wrapping only a graph view
Constructs a RuleContext for action execution, binding the acting entity as the actor and optionally a current entity as self
Derives a new RuleContext from an existing one with a different entity set as self, leaving all other bindings unchanged
Converts any supported relationship direction alias (in/out/both and variants) into its canonical string form
Converts any supported comparison operator alias (eq/gt/lt and variants) into its canonical string form
Evaluates a comparison between two operands using a canonical comparison operator and returns the boolean result
Clamps a numeric prominence value to the valid 0-4 integer index range representing the five prominence tiers
Returns the signed difference between two numeric prominence values for use in sorting or threshold comparisons
Converts a numeric prominence score into its corresponding display label string (forgotten, marginal, recognized, renowned, or mythic)
Returns the lower numeric bound for a named prominence tier, enabling threshold comparisons against labeled levels
Constrains a prominence value to the valid numeric range [0, 5], preventing out-of-bounds prominence scores
Evaluates a single declarative condition against an entity in a rule context, dispatching to the appropriate typed condition handler
Computes the numeric value of a metric (entity count, relationship count, prominence, ratio, etc.) within the current rule context
Computes the raw integer count for a simple count metric (entity count or relationship count) for use in ratio calculations
Produces a human-readable description string for a metric definition, used for logging and debugging output
Looks up or linearly interpolates the prominence multiplier value for a given numeric prominence score using a per-level multiplier table
Computes a MutationResult describing all graph changes a mutation would produce without immediately applying them to the graph
Prepares and immediately applies a mutation to the graph, returning the resulting MutationResult for tracking
Commits a previously prepared MutationResult to the graph, performing all deferred entity and relationship changes
Merges a tag patch (additions and deletions) onto a base tag map, producing an updated tag record
Computes the minimal tag patch (additions and deletions) needed to transform a before tag map into an after tag map
Filters an entity list by applying a single typed selection filter (exclude, has_relationship, tag match, etc.)
Reduces an entity list by applying a sequence of selection filters in order using AND logic
Tests whether a single entity satisfies a given selection filter without requiring a full list reduction
Tests whether a single entity satisfies every filter in a list, returning false on the first failure
Executes a full SelectionRule against the current graph, applying criteria, filters, preferences, and pick strategies to return a matched entity list
Selects candidate entities for a variable binding by evaluating a VariableSelectionRule's criteria and filters against the graph
Resolves one variable selection to a single entity by evaluating candidates and applying pick strategy, making it available for subsequent variable bindings
Resolves an ordered set of variable selections for a self entity, threading each resolved entity into subsequent selections as a new binding
Filters an entity list by base selection criteria such as kind, subtype, status, culture, and tag requirements
Narrows an entity list to those passing prefer filters, falling back to the full original list if no entities pass
Applies a pick strategy (random, highest prominence, lowest prominence, nearest, etc.) to select up to maxResults entities from a candidate list
Removes entities from a candidate list that have already reached their maximum relationship count for the relevant relationship type
Produces a human-readable description string for a selection filter definition, used for trace logging and debugging
Traverses the entity graph from a starting entity along a declared relationship path and tests whether the terminal assertion holds
Determines whether an entity satisfies all actor requirements (kind, subtype, tag filters) specified in an action's actor configuration
Converts any supported relationship direction alias into its canonical string form for consistent internal processing

Evaluates a comparison between two operands using a canonical operator and returns the boolean result

Returns the signed difference between two numeric prominence values for sorting or threshold comparison
Counts how many entities of each kind exist in the graph, returning a record keyed by entity kind
Converts a record of raw counts into proportional ratios normalized against a provided total
Summarizes the distribution of entities across the five prominence tiers with both counts and ratios
Summarizes the distribution of relationship types in the graph with counts, ratios, and a diversity score
Computes graph connectivity statistics including isolated node count, average connections, and connection range
Summarizes the distribution of entities across subtypes with both raw counts and proportional ratios
Looks up the metadata record for a named tag in a tag registry, returning undefined if the tag is not registered
Returns all tag metadata records that belong to a specific category from the tag registry
Extracts all tag registry entries that have consolidation mappings, returning from/to pairs for tags that should be merged
Checks whether two tags are mutually exclusive according to their conflict lists in the tag registry
Checks an entity's tag collection for conflicting tag pairs and returns a list of detected violations
Retrieves all entities from the graph that are capable of taking actions, optionally filtered to a specific agent category
Tests whether an entity has the catalyst.canAct tag set to true, indicating it is eligible to initiate actions
Annotates a relationship with the ID of the agent entity that caused it to be created, enabling attribution tracking
Returns all relationships and entities in the graph that were attributed to a specific catalyst agent entity
Tests whether an entity has at least one relationship of a given kind in the specified direction

Instantiates a SimulationSystem that evolves existing relationships over time by strengthening, weakening, or archiving them based on declared rules

Instantiates a SimulationSystem that fires a declared mutation whenever a monitored metric crosses a specified threshold

Splits an array into sequential sub-arrays of a fixed maximum size for batch processing

Returns all key-value pairs from an entity's tag map where the value is a string
Converts an array of tag strings (plain keys or key:value pairs) into the EntityTags key-value-pair format

Selects and returns one element at random from an array
Selects and returns up to count distinct elements at random from an array without replacement

Generates a unique string ID with a given prefix by appending a monotonically incrementing counter
